turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Tarvin.
turn.1: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article on Tarvin?
turn.2: A Saxon cross dating to the 10th/11th century has been unearthed by archaeologists in Tarvin.
turn.4: The find, made in a Civil War trench, is very rare.
turn.6: The Saxon cross may have been broken up before the assault of Chester in 1645 by the Parliamentary garrison.
turn.7: What other aspects of Tarvin are interesting?
turn.8: Tarvin appears as a substantial manor in the Domesday Book of 1086 (listed as Terve), the largest community in the Hundred of Rushton with 30 households.
turn.10: Tarvin Manor comprises some 2000 acres of cultivable land (22 ploughlands) as well as 'woodland'.
turn.11: Who were some of its notable residents?
turn.12: The Domesday Book records the Lord of Tarvin Manor in 1066 as the bishop of Chester St John, and the same in 1086 but adds the name William Malbank, who was named as Lord or Tenant-in-Chief across over 100 manors in Cheshire after the conquest.
